{{Infobox person | name = Marco Robinson | image = Marco Robinson .jpg | alt = <!-- descriptive text for use by speech synthesis (text-to-speech) software --> | caption = Award Winning Entrepreneur, Prime Time TV Star, Philanthropist and #1 Bestselling Author | birth_name = <!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1968|05|16}} | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (DEATH date then BIRTH date) --> | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = Marco Robinson in an Award Winning Entrepreneur, Prime Time TV Star, Philanthropist, #1 Bestselling Author, Winner of the iProperty People's Choice Awards Best Real Estate Company, Singapore 2014/15Entrepreneur, World Renowned Property Investor, and Restaurateur | years_active = | known_for = Marco Robinson is known for his worldwide success as an Entrepreneur and active Philanthropical work. | notable_works = | website = {{URL|www.marcorobinson.com}} https://www.marcorobinson360.com/ }} '''Marco Robinson''' (born May 16, 1968) Marco Robinson is an Award Winning Entrepreneur, Prime Time TV Star, Philanthropist, #1 [https://www.marcorobinson.com/books.html Bestselling Author], Winner of the iProperty People's Choice Awards Best Real Estate Company, World Renowned Property Investor, and Restaurateur<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.lincolnshirelive.co.uk/news/local-news/tv-millionaire-who-taken-task-932887 |title=TV millionaire who was taken to task by teacher visits her school |last=Fletcher |first=Nicholas |date=2017-12-15 |website=lincolnshirelive}}</ref> Robinson is best known for television show ''[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/meet-man-gave-away-three-bedroom-house-free/ Get a House For Free]''.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.channel4.com/programmes/get-a-house-for-free/on-demand/64040-001 |title=Get a House For Free - On Demand - All 4 |website=www.channel4.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/teenager-mother-new-home-millionaire-homeless-tears-crying-holly-bethany-marco-robinson-a7886146.html |title=Teenage mother given house by millionaire who used to be homeless |date=2017-08-10 |website=The Independent |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news.com.au/finance/money/wealth/marco-richardson-went-from-living-in-a-park-to-building-40-million-empire/news-story/e083b2a405a03c578631ff18285e0417 |title=Rags to riches: Homeless man becomes a millionaire |last=Lambert |first=Olivia |website=NewsComAu}}</ref> He is also the founder of the NAKED Group of Companies including the Naked Restaurant and Bar www.nakedrestaurantkl.com recently opened in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
==Biography== Robinson's childhood was traumatic, at the age of two, his parents separated. Robinson and his mother regularly moved from one place to another. He left formal education at the age of 16 to work as a cleaner and later on started a job in sales.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-3426789/Businessman-diet-mini-bars-boozy-lunches-led-heart-failure-swimwear-model.html |title=Unhealthy dad, 47, whose 'boozy lunches' led to a heart attack becomes a model after swapping his high-pressure job for the gym |last=Unity |first=Blott |date=2006-02-03 |website=Mail Online}}</ref> In 2008, after being fired and divorced, Robinson came up with the idea of creating a travel rewards business for employees at multinational corporations.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/meet-man-gave-away-three-bedroom-house-free/ |title=Meet the man who gave away a three-bedroom house for free |last=Sanghani |first=Radhika |date=2017-08-08 |website=The Telegraph |language=en-GB}}</ref> After his initial success, he expanded into property investment and founded luxury brand the Naked Group.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.londonlovesbusiness.com/entrepreneurs/famous-entrepreneurs/marco-robinson-suffered-a-heart-attack-at-29-now-he-runs-multi-million-pound-businesses/12452.article |title=Marco Robinson suffered a heart attack at 29, now he runs multi-million-pound businesses |last=Dunsby |first=Sarah |date=11 July 2016 |website=londonlovesbusiness |language=en}}</ref>
After making it to the top of the Corporate World, by taking a Malaysian Public company from broke to 1 Billion Dollars in three years, he soon realized that the employee life was not for him. After some personal intervention, he hired a personal mentor and started to create his own Empire in a bid to be different and make a difference.
Marco built several Multi-Million Dollar companies from scratch such as the “Wealth Revolution Group”; “Create Demand Incentive Programs”; “The Rich List”; “NAKED Restaurants” and more. He personally owns over 100 properties and became a Multi-Millionaire property Investor and World Authority Speaker on Investing and speaks worldwide to hundreds and thousands of people...
In 2017, Robinson decided to give away a flat in [[Preston, Lancashire|Preston]] and make a documentary on it. His documentary aired on [[Channel 4]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/01/29/millionaire-is-giving-away-a-120000-apartment-for-free-6413428/ |title=Millionaire is giving away a £120,000 flat for free |last=Mills |first=Jen |date=2017-01-29 |website=Metro |language=en-GB}}</ref>
==Awards and recognition== In 2008, Robinson received Entrepreneur of the Year award. In December 2014, he was honored with the title of Dato' Seri for his contribution towards humanitarian causes in [[Malaysia]].<ref>{{Cite book |url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=HEO8CwAAQBAJ&pg=PA151&lpg=PA151&dq=marco+robinson+dato%2527+seri&source=bl&ots=cZP6PSBX_F&sig=V7-G9dk_Kmn7GARC-ouQMvctses&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwir--64j4nbAhUJHJQKHRlhCtc4FBDoAQg8MAQ#v=onepage&q=marco%2520robinson%2520dato'%2520seri&f=false |title=The Financial Freedom Guarantee: The 10-Step Award Winning Property Buying System Anyone Can Use to Replace Their Salary, Fire Their Boss, and Never Work Again |last=Robinson |first=Marco |date=2016-04-05 |publisher=Morgan James Publishing |isbn=9781630479312 |language=en}}</ref> which is equivalent to a Knighthood in England.
He has also appeared on Bloomberg TV, The USA Herald, Readers Digest, the MAIL Online, Ogilvy DO Debates, The Daily Globe, FOX News, The Examiner.com, The Napoleon Hill Foundation, The Star Newspaper Group, The New Strait Times, TV3, TV2, Bernama TV, Capital TV, Astro, etc.
Selling over 50 Million USD$ worth of Investment Property to his customers through his Wealth Revolution Group & Property Champions, contributed to him earning the People’s Choice Best Real Estate Investment Company in Singapore 2014/15.
He became a #1 Bestselling Author of the legendary book “[https://www.amazon.com/Close-Deal-Suddenly-Grow-Rich-ebook/dp/B07BRVB5TS/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1539039752&sr=8-3&keywords=marco+robinson Close the Deal and Suddenly Grow Rich]”.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Robinson, Marco}} [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Businesspeople]]

{{Infobox person | name = Mario Teguh | image = | caption = | birth_name = Sis Maryono Teguh | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|03|05|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Makassar]], [[Indonesia]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = {{hlist|[[Consultant]]|[[entrepreneur]]|[[motivation|motivator]]|[[psychologist]]|[[author]]|[[philosopher]]}} | years_active = | spouse = {{Marriage|Linna Susanto|January 28, 1995}} | partner = | children = Ario Kiswinar Teguh
Audrey Teguh
Marco Teguh | parents = Gozali Teguh (father)
Sitti Marwiyah (mother) | website = {{URL|www.marioteguh.asia}} | influences = | influenced = | imagesize = | other_name = }} '''Mario Teguh''' (born '''Sis Maryono Teguh'''; March 5, 1956) is an Indonesian motivational speaker and consultant. In 2010, Teguh has been listed as one of 8 Personality Changes version of newspaper [[Republika (Indonesian newspaper)|Republika]]. Teguh had more popularity in public when he was a presenter for ''Mario Teguh Golden Ways'' in [[Metro TV]]. Before he began his career, Teguh had been working in several banks, such as [[Citibank]], [[BSB Bank]], and [[Aspac Bank]]. Teguh was also establishing for his businessman Exnal Corp Jakarta where he served as [[CEO]] and senior consultant. Teguh presented a show, titled ''Business Art'' on [[O Channel]]. Teguh is one of the most expensive motivator in Indonesia. == Career == * Citibank Indonesia (1983–1986) as Head of Sales * BSB Bank (1986–1989) as Manager Business Development * Aspac Bank (1990–1994) as Vice President Marketing & Organization Development * Exnal Corp Jakarta (1994–present) as CEO & Senior Consultant ** Specialization: Business Effectiveness Consultant == Education == * Department of Architecture New Trier West High (level SMA) in Chicago, United States, 1975. * Department of Linguistics and language education, Institut Keguruan dan Ilmu Pendidikan Malang ([[Bachelor's degree|S-1]]). * Department of International Business, Sophia University, Tokyo, Japan. * Department of Operations Systems, Indiana University, United States, 1983 (MBA). == Books == * ''Becoming a Star'' (2006) * ''One Million Second Chances'' (2006) * ''Life Changer'' (2009) * ''Leadership Golden Ways'' (2009) == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{official website|www.marioteguh.asia}} {{id}} * [http://www.mtgwpoll.com Mario Teguh Golden Ways polling] {{id}} * [http://www.redmario.com Mario Teguh one liners] {{id}} * [http://www.mtsuperclub.com Mario Teguh Super Club] {{id}} * [http://facebook.marioteguh.asia Mario Teguh facebook] {{id}} * [http://twitter.marioteguh.asia Twitter MTLovenHoney] {{id}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Teguh, Mario}} [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Makassar]] [[Category:Indonesian writers]] [[Category:Indonesian businesspeople]] {{Indonesia-writer-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2017}} {{Infobox person | image = | image_size = | name = Nicola Bulgari | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1941}} | birth_place = Rome, Italy | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = Italian | religion = | ethnicity = | residence = Rome, Italy | education = | alma mater = | occupation = Vice-chairman of [[Bulgari]] | known for = | salary = | networth = [[United States dollar|$]]1.31 billion (January 2017) | spouse = Anna Bulgari
[[Beatrice Bulgari]] (nee Bordoni) | parents = [[Giorgio Bulgari (born 1890)|Giorgio Bulgari]] | children = 6 | relatives = [[Gianni Bulgari]] (brother)
[[Paolo Bulgari]] (brother) | website = }} '''Nicola Bulgari''' (born 1941) is an Italian billionaire businessman, grandson of Sotirios Bulgari, the founder of the luxury brand [[Bulgari]]. ==Early life== Nicola Bulgari was born in Rome{{cite news|title=20 Odd Questions: Nicola Bulgari|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748704132204576285342859175166|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=WSJ|date=30 April 2011}} in 1941,{{cite web|author=Joseph Giovannini,Timothy White |url=http://www.architecturaldigest.com/story/bulgari-article-2008-07 |title=Nicola Bulgari's American Gems |publisher=Architectural Digest |date=30 June 2008 |accessdate=24 January 2017}} the third son of [[Giorgio Bulgari (born 1890)|Giorgio Bulgari]] (1890–1966). His brother [[Gianni Bulgari|Gianni]] was born in 1935 and [[Paolo Bulgari|Paolo]] in 1937.{{cite web|title=Bulgari|url=http://www.hancocks-london.com/content/bulgari|website=Hancocks|publisher=Hancocks|accessdate=31 May 2015}} ==Career== He has been vice-chairman of Bulgari since 1984. In 2013, after allegations of tax evasion, the [[Guardia di Finanza]] (tax police), raided the Bulgari office in Rome's Via Condotti, as part of a Euro 46 million seizure of assets. In May 2015, Paolo and Nicola Bulgari and 11 others were ordered by an Italian judge to stand trial on charges of tax evasion. Both deny the charges.{{cite news|last1=Kirchgaessner|first1=Stephanie|title=Italian tax clampdown dims the sparkle at Bulgari|url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/may/29/italian-tax-clampdown-bulgari|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=The Guardian|date=29 May 2015}} In January 2017, ''[[Forbes]]'' estimated the net worth of Nicola Bulgari at US$1.31 billion.{{cite web|title=The World's Billionaires: Nicola Bulgari|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/nicola-bulgari/|website=Forbes|accessdate=24 January 2017}} He received the ''America Award'' of the [[Italy-USA Foundation]] in 2015. ==Personal life== He has six children and lives in Rome. His first wife was Anna, and they were married prior to 1981,{{cite web|last=Ferretti |first=Fred |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1981/12/11/style/glittery-world-of-two-jewelers.html |title=Glittery World Of Two Jewelers |location=New York City; Italy |website=NYTimes.com |date=11 December 1981 |accessdate=24 January 2017}} until at least 1994.{{cite book|author=New York Media, LLC|title=New York Magazine|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=M-QCAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA63|accessdate=24 January 2017|date=12 December 1994|publisher=New York Media, LLC|page=63|issn=0028-7369}} His second wife [[Beatrice Bulgari]] (nee Bordoni){{cite web|url=http://www.newyorksocialdiary.com/travel/2009/to-rome-for-bulgaris-125th-anniversary |title=To Rome for Bulgari's 125th anniversary |publisher=New York Social Diary |date=29 May 2009 |accessdate=24 January 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.it/en/people-are-talking-about/art-photo-design/2011/06/short-films-at-maxxi-museum?refresh_ce=|title=Art show movies|publisher=Vogue Italia |date=6 August 2011 |accessdate=31 May 2017}} {{cite web|last=Christopher |first=Lord |url=http://clothesonfilm.com/cinema-paradiso-invisible-costume/35571/ |title=Cinema Paradiso: Invisible Costume |publisher=Clothes on Film |date= |accessdate=24 January 2017}} is a costume designer, responsible for the costumes for the film ''[[Cinema Paradiso]]''.{{cite news|last1=Ginsberg|first1=Merle|title=Bulgari's Nicola Bulgari Talks Receiving the Rodeo Drive Walk of Style Award (Q&A)|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/fash-track/bulgaris-nicola-bulgari-talks-receiving-399019|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=Hollywood Reporter|date=6 December 2012}} He collects vintage cars, especially American marques, in both [[Allentown, Pennsylvania]], and Rome. His 21-acre facility in Allentown houses 125 cars in seven warehouses. He has 85 or more cars in Rome, including the faster models, and flies them to Allentown when they need repairs.{{cite news|last1=Shaftel|first1=David|title=Rough Gems, Brought to a Fine Polish|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/12/automobiles/rough-gems-brought-to-a-fine-polish.html|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=NY Times|date=10 October 2014}} His favourite marque is [[Buick]] and he has many from 1940 and 1941, coincidentally the year he was born. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bulgari, Nicola}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1941 births]] [[Category:People from Rome]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Allentown, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Bulgari family]] [[Category:Businesspeople in fashion]] [[Category:Italian billionaires]] [[Category:Italian businesspeople]] [[Category:Italian people of Greek descent]] [[Category:Italian people of Aromanian descent]] [[Category:Car collectors]] {{Italy-business-bio-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Patricia Szarvas | image= Patricia Szarvas.jpg | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1970|1|21|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Vienna]] | death_date = | death_place = | education = Economics and Communications | occupation = [[Discussion moderator|moderator]], media coach, [[writer]] | agent = | salary = | title = | children = | relatives = | family = | birthname = Patricia Szarvas | age = | alias = | status = | spouse = | networth = | credits = ''[[Morning Exchange (CNBC Europe)|Morning Exchange]]'' and ''[[Power Lunch Europe]]'' co-anchor
[[CNBC Europe]] main anchor | URL = }} '''Patricia Szarvas''' (born 21 January 1970 in [[Vienna]], [[Austria]]) is a freelance [[Discussion moderator|moderator]], executive [[Media (communication)|media]] [[Coaching|coach]] and [[writer]]. For over 14 years she was a [[finance|financial]] [[journalist]] and [[News presenter|anchor]] of [[CNBC Europe|CNBC TV]] based in [[London]]. Moving on to [[Germany]], she reported daily from the [[Frankfurt]] [[stock exchange]] on business and financial markets for many international studios of the CNBC network. She also reported for the German television station [[N24 (Germany)|N24]]. Prior to CNBC she worked for the Italian broadcaster [[RAI 3]] in [[Rome]]. == Biography == After studying Economics and Communications Patricia Szarvas worked as a [[broker]], private [[banker]] and [[portfolio (finance)|portfolio manager]] in [[Frankfurt]], [[London]] and [[Luxembourg]] and was a registered [[stockbroker]] at the [[London Stock Exchange]]. She speaks five languages, German, English, French, Italian and Slovak. She has a daughter born in 2005.{{cite news | title = Patricia Szarvas | publisher = [[Women's Forum for the Economy and Society]] | url = http://www.womens-forum.com/speaker/global-meeting-2011/patricia-szarvas | accessdate = 2013-01-21}}{{cite news | title = Patricia Szarvas | publisher = [[International Telecommunication Union]] | url = http://www.itu.int/tlc/WORLD2009/forum/participants/submissions/auth/19115/bio_19115.doc | accessdate = 2013-01-21}}{{cite news | title = Patricia Szarvas | publisher = Büro Lönne Navarro (Management) | url = http://ankeloenne.com/seite/patricia-szarvas/ | accessdate = 2013-01-21 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120902000032/http://www.ankeloenne.com/seite/patricia-szarvas/ | archivedate = 2012-09-02 | df = }} From 1989 to 1999 she headed the stock exchange news department at the [[Italy|Italian]] public service broadcaster [[RAI]].{{cite news | title = CNBC-Anchor Szarvas: Börsenjournalismus in Krisenzeiten | publisher = DWDL | url = http://dwdl.de/article/story_18971,00.html | accessdate = 2008-12-19}} In 1999 she joined CNBC in [[London]], where she became the co-anchor of the business news programmes ''[[Morning Exchange (CNBC Europe)|Morning Exchange]]'' and ''[[Power Lunch Europe]]''.{{cite news | title = Patricia Szarvas hosts "Power Lunch Europe." | publisher = [[CNBC Europe]] | url = https://www.cnbc.com/id/15890596/ | accessdate = 2007-11-15 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110611071312/http://www.cnbc.com/id/15890596/ | archive-date = 2011-06-11 | dead-url = yes | df = }} She was the main contributor to CNBC's [[Capital Connection (TV series)|Capital Connection]], [[Worldwide Exchange]] and [[Squawk Box Europe]]. She also was chief reporter for the [[automotive industry]].{{cite news | title = Patricia Szarvas | publisher = [[CNBC Europe]] | url = https://www.cnbc.com/id/15838721/ | accessdate = 2007-11-15}} Patricia Szarvas also moderates international political summits, economic and corporate conferences,{{cite news|url=http://www.weforum.org/pdf/SummitReports/EES_report_2004_24_MAY.pdf|title=European Economic Summit 2004, Executive Summary|publisher=[[World Economic Forum]]|date=2004-05-24|accessdate=2008-01-17|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070221125952/http://www.weforum.org/pdf/SummitReports/EES_report_2004_24_MAY.pdf|archivedate=2007-02-21|df=}}{{cite news|publisher=Maliki Group|url=http://www.malekigroup.com/web/media/event/de/Corporate-Responsibility_programme_2007_4604.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110714024209/http://www.malekigroup.com/web/media/event/de/Corporate-Responsibility_programme_2007_4604.pdf|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2011-07-14|title=Conference Programme|date=2007-11-27|accessdate=2008-01-17}}{{cite news| url=http://www.com.sult.cc/|title=com.sult|publisher=Create Connections Networking & Lobbying GmbH|accessdate=2008-01-17}} such as the [[World Economic Forum]] (WEF) in [[Davos]],{{cite news|publisher=[[BusinessWeek]]|date=2004-01-23|url=http://www.businessweek.com/bwdaily/dnflash/jan2004/nf20040123_2499.htm|title=The Odder Side of the WEF|accessdate=2008-01-17}} [[Digital Life Design]] (DLD) in [[Munich]], Northern Light in [[Helsinki]], Euro Finance Week in [[Frankfurt]]. == Books == * Ricca Germania poveri tedeschi. Il lato oscuro del benessere (Università Bocconi, March 2014, in Italian) == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120902000032/http://www.ankeloenne.com/seite/patricia-szarvas/ Biography on management site] * [http://www.gogomag.com/ps2/ Screen caps from gogomag.com]{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} == Sources == * {{cite news | first=Manuel | last=Weis | title=CNBC: Patricia Szarvas neues Gesicht des Senders in Frankfurt | url=http://www.quotenmeter.de/?newsid=23123 | language=German | date=2007-10-26 | accessdate=2007-11-15 | publisher=[[CNBC Europe]]}} * {{cite news | title=Patricia Szarvas berichtet ab sofort für CNBC und N24 von der Frankfurter Börse | url=http://www.satundkabel.de/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=26589 | language=German | date=2007-10-26 | accessdate=2007-11-15 | publisher=Sat+Kabel}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} == References == {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Szarvas, Patricia}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:Women television journalists]] [[Category:Business and financial journalists]] [[Category:Austrian financial analysts]] [[Category:Women financial analysts]] [[Category:Stockbrokers]] [[Category:Austrian journalists]] [[Category:CNBC Europe]] [[Category:People from Vienna]] [[Category:Women stockbrokers]]
